result.execSummary:
The defendant Shanel L Torstenson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obtain Prescription Drug w/ Fraud, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(a).
  • Obtain Prescription Drug w/ Fraud, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(a).
  • Obtain Prescription Drug w/ Fraud, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shanel L Torstenson in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

AS TO COUNTS 1 THROUGH 3:

On motion of the state, the court amended ALL THREE (3) charges to Obtain Prescription Drug w/ Fraud, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 450.11(7)(a), a class U Misdemeanor.   Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Court sentenced defendant to serve TWO (2) DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for TWO (2) days served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

AS TO COUNTS 2 AND THREE:

Court sentenced defendant to serve TWO (2) DAYS in the House of Correction CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1 with credit for TWO (2) days served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 02-13-2017 or a civil judgment to be entered WITH tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

Defendant Shanel L Torstenson in court with attorney Cynthia M. Wynn.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

ALL COUNTS:
The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for September 25, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Case transferred to br 6 for drug treatment court admissions on 9/24/2014 at 1:30pm.  lms

Defendant Shanel L Torstenson in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is scheduled for Plea and Sentencing. Defense requests the case be rescheduled for the reasons that are placed on the record. Court orders case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing on 11-4-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shanel L Torstenson in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
At the request of the Defense, Court orders case for adjourned Plea and Sentencing.
Court notes there is not an objection to a global resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shanel L Torstenson in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Effective August 3, 2014, this case will be assigned to Judge Carolina Stark, Branch 17, Room 313 of the Safety Building.  JURY TRIAL TO BE SCHEDULED ON NEXT DATE.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shanel L Torstenson in court with attorney Mary G Guimont.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case being considered for drug treatment court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shanel L Torstenson in court with attorney Mary G Guimont.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties need more time for negotiations.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 06-26-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shanel L Torstenson in court with attorney Mary G Guimont.  Nathaniel Adamson for Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances (no illegal drugs) without a valid prescription. 
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON MAY 28, 2014. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Shanel L Torstenson in court with attorney Mary G Guimont.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 5-27-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
